intro: Micranthes atrata, commonly known as blackroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant's unique appearance and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
